result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela J. Furler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Intimidation of a Victim, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
No credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes: Court orders restitution to be paid within 90 days.

No contact with B.O. or her family. 
Defendant not to consume or possess alcohol or enter into any bars, liquor stores, taverns or any place that primarily sells or serves alcohol.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela J. Furler

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $240.00
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
notice of right to seek post conviction relief.

9:45 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angela J. Furler in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Angela J. Furler. 
There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Intimidation of a Victim (no repeater). 
Victim makes a Statement before sentencing. Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 36 months with conditions: 
No Contact with victim: B.O. or her family. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any bars, liquor stores, or taverns or any place where alcohol is primarily served. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $240.00 plus applicable surcharges. Restitution ordered to be paid within 90 days. 
Pay court costs including DNA sample and applicable surcharges. 
Defendant has no credit if revoked from Probation.

(10:06 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Angela J. Furler in court. Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Angela J. Furler.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
Attorney Amundson to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.

(11:07 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Angela J. Furler appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Angela J. Furler.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on April 18, 2022 at 2 pm.
Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
